channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Max, there are potholes all the way up Leckhampton hill. Massively bad ride up to the top. All this focus on re-surfacing back streets in Cheltenham but when is this main road going to get attention?, 19th October
item.description:
All the way up Leckhampton hill to the road works at the Air Balloon.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leckhampton Hill, Shurdington, Tewkesbury

item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Heavy road flooding, 19th October
item.description:
At the entrance to the corner of Montpellier Gardens there seems to be a blocked drain caused by heavy leaf litter. I believe I reported a similar issue over 7 months ago and the issue seems to have got worse?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 56, Montpellier Spa Road, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain n heavy vegetation, 19th October
item.description:
The drain is blocked and the surface water is obstructing the drop down pedestrian kerb. There is also heavy vegetation in the road gully. The flooding was worse today 19th Oct than previous days so is only getting worse. It's located infront of Rainbowls

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 64, Hewlett Road, Whaddon, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain is continuously blocked, 19th October
item.description:
This is on going and has been reported many times. PLEASE SORT IT OUT!!! Cars have to swerve to avoid the water- it’s dangerous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Lansdown Parade, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep hole - lethal hazard, 19th October
item.description:
The hole is athe side of the street cabinet t the coach station. We were visiting as a theatre group of senior citizens and a lady stopped to place her bag on top of the cabinet to retieve an item. She placed her foot to the side of the cabinet and there was a very deep hole, filled with leaves, so invisible. She fell heavily backwards and as afar as can be assessed at the moment has not incurred any serious injury other than bruising. She landed heavily on her back. This is a lethel trip hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Royal Crescent, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
